intro: Cissampelos kohautiana, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing perennial vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, fleshy, orange-red berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types make it adaptable to different environments. The botanical features of Cissampelos kohautiana make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
